The problem with public education is not money, as people like to believe. Several states have doubled their spending in ten year periods, federal spending is up 40% in three years.
 
 The problem with public education are the teachers unions. They control everything about American schools.

 A certain type of vending machine is required in every teacher's lounge
 Only a certain number of damaged floor tiles may be replaced per month
 Custodians can only paint a wall up to 10 feet
 Teachers cannot be assigned to patrol halls, cafeterias, outside areas
 
 Why? Money and power, that's why. New York City has to spend 100 million dollars just on the last rule. The painters who have to be given the painting work and those teachers aides are all unionzed workers paying dues. Unions often manage to push through 5 and 10% pay raises, which means fewer new schools, fewer materials, etc.
